title: NMOS Transistor
description: Learn how an n-channel MOSFET is fabricated and operates

sections.title: What is a MOSFET?
sections.content:
A **Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor Field-Effect Transistor (MOSFET)** is a fundamental building block of modern integrated circuits. It acts as an electronic switch that can be turned on or off by applying voltage to its gate terminal.

**Key Components:**
- **Gate**: Control terminal
- **Source**: Electron entry point
- **Drain**: Electron exit point
- **Substrate**: Silicon base (p-type for NMOS)

MOSFETs are the basis for digital logic, memory, and almost all modern electronics.

sections.title: Why Are MOSFETs Important?
sections.content:
MOSFETs revolutionized electronics because they:

**Low Power**: Only consume power during switching

**Scalable**: Can be made incredibly small (currently 3nm process nodes)

**Fast**: Switch billions of times per second

**Dense**: Billions can fit on a single chip

Your smartphone contains over **10 billion MOSFETs** working together to create the computing power you use every day.

sections.title: Cross-Sectional View
sections.content:
Let's examine the MOSFET's structure layer by layer. Each material serves a specific purpose:

**Silicon Substrate** (bottom, blue): p-type doped silicon base

**Gate Oxide** (thin red layer): Insulator that blocks current but allows electric field

**Polysilicon Gate** (yellow): Metal electrode that controls the channel

**Source/Drain** (green regions): Heavily n-doped regions for electron injection/collection

The spacing between source and drain is called the **channel length** - a critical dimension that determines transistor speed.

sections.title: OFF State (Vgs < Vth)
sections.content:
When the gate voltage is **below the threshold voltage (Vth)**, the MOSFET is OFF:

**No Channel**: The p-type substrate blocks electron flow between source and drain

**High Resistance**: Current cannot flow (except tiny leakage)

**Logic '0'**: In digital circuits, this represents a zero bit

The device acts like an open switch - no connection between source and drain.

sections.title: ON State (Vgs > Vth)
sections.content:
When gate voltage **exceeds the threshold voltage**, the MOSFET turns ON:

**Inversion Layer**: Electric field attracts electrons to the surface, creating an n-type channel

**Low Resistance**: Electrons can flow freely from source to drain

**Logic '1'**: In digital circuits, this represents a one bit

The device acts like a closed switch - source and drain are connected through the channel.
